content.title: Technical Education Scholarship Scheme For Degree Level
content.beneficiary: Students pursuing P.G. Courses/Degree Level Courses in Engineering/Technology
content.details: The scheme 'Technical Education Scholarship Scheme For Degree Level' was started by the Department of Technical Education, Himachal Pradesh. Under the scheme, the scholarships will be awarded to the P.G. Courses/Degree Level Courses in Engineering/Technology including Architecture or any other equivalent course approved by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE). The total number of Scholarships for P.G. and degree-level Courses will be 175 Number.
benefits: The value of the scholarship for General Category students shall be ₹300/- per month.
The value of the scholarship for SC/ST students shall be ₹500/- per month.
100% Scholarships shall be awarded to the SC and ST Students in P.G./Degree Courses.
eligibility: Only those students shall be eligible for the award of scholarships who are Bonafide Himachali and ward of Himachal Pradesh Government employees.

The Scholarships will be awarded to those students who are pursuing the P.G. Courses /Degree level Courses in Engineering /Technology including Architecture or any other equivalent course approved by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE).
The Scholarship shall be awarded only if the total income of parents or guardians from all the sources is not more than ₹36000/- per annum.
exclusions: Students getting scholarships from other sources or under some other scheme shall not be eligible for a grant of the same under these rules.
content.application_process: Online submission of the application form can be done through the website of the National Scholarship Portal.
documents_required: Previous Year(s) Result Card(s) from Matric onwards
Income Certificate of Parent/Guardian (Issued by an officer not below the rank of Tehsildar)
Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account
Caste Certificate (Issued by an officer, not below the rank of Tehsildar)

faqs.question: What is the 'Technical Education Scholarship Scheme for Degree Level'?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, the scholarships will be awarded to the P.G. Courses/Degree Level Courses in Engineering/Technology including Architecture or any other equivalent course approved by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE).

faqs.question: Which is the implementing department of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Technical Education, Vocational and Industrial Training, Himachal Pradesh.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scholarships will be awarded to those students who are pursuing the P.G. Courses /Degree level Courses in Engineering/Technology including Architecture or any other equivalent course approved by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE).

faqs.question: Is this scholarship scheme only for the students of Himachal Pradesh?
faqs.answer: Yes, only those students shall be eligible for the award of scholarships who are Bonafide Himachali and ward of Himachal Pradesh Government employees.

faqs.question: What is the income criterion for applying under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scholarship shall be awarded only if the total income of parents or guardians from all the sources is not more than ₹36000/- per annum.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The value of the scholarship for General Category students shall be ₹300/- per month and for SC/ST students shall be ₹500/- per month.

faqs.question: How many students will receive the scholarship under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The total number of Scholarships for P.G. and degree-level Courses will be 175 Number.

faqs.question: On what basis will scholarship be awarded to students?
faqs.answer: The scholarship shall be awarded on the basis of (i) Poverty-cum-Brilliance and (ii) Brilliance.

faqs.question: Can a student avail of the benefits of the scholarship from second year of his/her course if not awarded scholarship in the first year?
faqs.answer: Yes, the students who are not awarded a scholarship from the date of joining of courses i.e. in the first year can also be considered for award of scholarships in subsequent years in case a number of scholarships are available due to dropouts, failure or otherwise.

faqs.question: How to apply for this scholarship?
faqs.answer: Online submission of the application form can be done through the website of the National Scholarship Portal.
